questions.question: At work, a primary motivator for me is...

answers.answer: Helping others do their best at work. I like to develop plans and communicate them to a team.
Improving a person’s quality of life and health. I like to help people.
Lifelong learning. I like to teach others and give them the tools to help themselves.
Making groundbreaking discoveries. I like to figure out how things work.
Finding insights in data. I like to develop and maintain systems and solve problems.
Health care providers and am interested in managing staff or finances.
Patients and other medical professionals.
Community residents, aspiring health care professionals, or people with disabilities.
Other scientists or medical professionals.
Medical professionals and computer systems.
In a hospital or physician’s office, but I’d be open to a residential care facility or government agency.
In a physician’s office, hospital, or outpatient care center.
At a government agency or nonprofit, but I’d be open to working at a university or family services organization.
In a lab or at a university, but I’d be open to working in a hospital or office.
In an office or hospital, but I’d be open to working in a technical services or administrative support organization.
Leading and communicating with others. I have good attention to detail and enjoy analyzing information and using technology.
Empathetic communication and emotional stablility. I have strong problem-solving and interpersonal skills.
Breaking down big ideas so others can learn. I’m also good at analyzing information to inform big-picture problem solving.
Critical thinking, observation, and data analysis. I can also communicate complex ideas simply while speaking and writing.
Organization, project management, data analysis, and creative problem solving.

questions.question: I have taken college courses in ...

answers.answer: Accounting, administration, ethics, or economics.
Physical sciences or health care.
Education, public health, ethics, or a language.
Physical science such as biology or chemistry.
Biology, computer science, math, or management.
Some experience in an administrative or clinical role.
Some experience working in a lab setting or with patients as a medic, nurse, medical assistant, EMT, etc.
Some experience working in education or with a community organization.
I have some experience working in a lab setting or doing research, writing proposals, and writing about my findings.
I have some experience working with computers, databases, or information systems.
